alert.note: Alert for Essex; Middlesex; Norfolk; Suffolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 10:55PM EDT until July 22 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT SATURDAY FOR NORTHEASTERN NORFOLK, SUFFOLK, SOUTH CENTRAL ESSEX AND EAST CENTRAL MIDDLESEX COUNTIES... At 1055 PM EDT, The last batch of downpours will move through greater Boston through midnight, then conditions will begin to improve. Until then, the expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of urban areas including highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Boston, Cambridge, Quincy, Lynn, Newton, Somerville, Malden, Brookline, Medford, Weymouth, Revere, Arlington, Everett, Woburn, Braintree, Chelsea, Randolph, Watertown, Lexington and Tewksbury. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
